"This did not happen in 3.1.1" is somewhat misleading, as the Refactoring History property page was only added in 3.2.  The page should probably not be available at all on closed projects.  Moving to JDT UI.

Tobias, I find the addition of a new, so specific property a bit too much. Wouldn't it be better to just check for that on the page and not show any UI but a simple label?
Or maybe it would be better if we require a the project to be a Java project. Other languages then won't get the page until they want to.

The reason why a new property had to be introduced was that no property was available which checks whether an arbitrary (adaptable) project is accessible. 

Not showing the property page is what the Java and CVS tooling does as well. IMHO I don't like to force language implementors to contribute UI which is programming-language independant, such as the mentioned property page.

The preference page now appears as soon as an accessible project has a refactoring history.

Fixed in R3_2_maintenance > 20060725

traces.message: Exception occurred while saving project preferences: /sasJP/.settings/org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.prefs.
